intro: Diplostephium heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has a sprawling, herbaceous growth habit. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. This species is often found in disturbed habitats and is valued for its ornamental potential in horticulture.
